>
>> Sorry, but it's REST that dictates the server's behavior.
>
>Oh dear.
>

Or, to phrase that better.  I can do whatever I want with the origin 
server, but REST constrains the behavior of the _connector_ that 
origin server uses to communicate with the outside world.

>
>(I didnâ€™t simply say â€œprior existence of the deleted resourceâ€
>because you insist that a URI and a resource are not the same
>thing.)
>

But they aren't the same thing.  A resource is a conceptual mapping, 
which may have one or more identifiers at a given point in time.  
The resource is still "a thing" even if one of its identifiers 
refers to "the thing of the day", because the URLs are each 
a separate identifier.  Even if their semantics identify the same 
resource at a given moment, the "thing of the day" URL is not 
the same thing as "a thing".

-Eric
